intro: Ophiorrhiza liukiuensis var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered liukiu mistflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan and is characterized by its small, white flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or rocky areas. It has a compact growth habit and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
